name: SecurityGroupIngress
description: The AWS::EC2::SecurityGroupIngress resource adds an ingress rule to an Amazon EC2 or Amazon VPC security group.

properties.name: FromPort
properties.description: Start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. If you specify icmp for the IpProtocol property, you can specify -1 as a wildcard (i.e., any ICMP type number).

properties.name: GroupId
properties.description: ID of the Amazon EC2 or VPC security group to modify. The group must belong to your account.

properties.name: GroupName
properties.description: Name of the Amazon EC2 security group (non-VPC security group) to modify. This value can be a reference to an AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resource or the name of an existing Amazon EC2 security group.

properties.name: IpProtocol
properties.description: IP protocol name or number. For valid values, see the IpProtocol parameter in AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress

properties.name: SourceSecurityGroupId
properties.description: Specifies the ID of the source security group or uses the Ref intrinsic function to refer to the logical ID of a security group defined in the same template.

properties.name: SourceSecurityGroupName
properties.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon EC2 security group (non-VPC security group) to allow access or uses the Ref intrinsic function to refer to the logical name of a security group defined in the same template. For instances in a VPC, specify the SourceSecurityGroupId property.

properties.name: SourceSecurityGroupOwnerId
properties.description: Specifies the AWS Account ID of the owner of the Amazon EC2 security group specified in the SourceSecurityGroupName property.

properties.name: ToPort
properties.description: End of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code. If you specify icmp for the IpProtocol property, you can specify -1 as a wildcard (i.e., any ICMP code).
